message_1: Suppose a data analyst has a data set of 50 observations. The mean of the data set is 12 and the standard deviation is 5. Calculate the z-score for an observation that has a value of 18.
message_2:
To calculate the z-score for an observation with a value of 18, we use the following formula:

z = (X - μ) / σ

where z is the z-score, X is the observation value, μ is the mean, and σ is the standard deviation.

In this case, X = 18, μ = 12, and σ = 5. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

z = (18 - 12) / 5
z = 6 / 5
z = 1.2

So, the z-score for an observation with a value of 18 is 1.2.
